edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.dc.api
Class DCMessageHeader

java.lang.Object
  edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.dc.api.DCMessageHeader

public class DCMessageHeader
extends java.lang.Object

Represents the standard header of a DC API message. This object can be generated by specifying each individual parameter or from the raw bytes of a DC API packet . The former is useful when generating a DC API request and the latter is useful when a DC API request is received. In addition, this class makes it convenient to go from an object representation of a DC API header to the raw bytes understood by a DC API server. It's also useful to note that this class contains many static values important for setting options that control the meaning of a DC request.

Author:
Andrew Lake (alake@internet2.edu)

Constructor Detail

DCMessageHeader

public DCMessageHeader(int type,
                         int bodyLength,
                         int[] opt,
                         int vtag)
Generate an object representation or a DC API header by setting specific values. Useful when creating a new DC API request.

Parameters:
type - the type of DC request to make. Refer to the TYPE_* constants for acceptable values.
bodyLength - the length of the body of this API message
opt - an array of options to set in this header. Refer to the OPT_* constants for acceptable values.
vtag - The VTAG returned or used by this request. It may be a number from 1-4096 or use the static VTAG_* constants for special cases (i.e. No VLAN or or application chooses VLAN)

DCMessageHeader

public DCMessageHeader(byte[] packet)
Constructor that generate an object of this class from a raw DC API packet (including body of the message). Useful when a DC API message is received and the values of the header need to be extracted.

Parameters:
packet - a byte represenation of the entire DC API packet (including the body of the message)
